column2: Specify
Score Sections I-III
Score Section IV:
Rate function during the preceding 2 week period only according to caregiver - Vision
column18: 1 = Mild. Limited eye or head movement to large objects or parental face in visual field
column19: 2 = Moderate. No response to large objects or parental face in the visual field

column2: Rate function during the preceding 2 week period only according to caregiver - Hearing
column18: 1 = Mild. Body, head or eye movement only to loud noise
column19: 2 = Moderate. No reaction to loud noise

column2: Rate function during the preceding 2 week period only according to caregiver - communication (assessed with appropriate regard for age)
column19: 2 = Moderate. Communication unintelligible to parents or completely reliant on non-verbal communication
column20: 3 = Severe. Not communicating effectively in any form

column2: Rate function during the preceding 2 week period only according to caregiver - Feeding
column18: 1 = Mild. Difficulties in sucking / coughing / anorexia / wheezy with feeds or occasional choking
column19: 2 = Moderate. Supplementary enteral feeding or recurrent aspiration pneumonia
column20: 3 = Severe. Exclusive enteral feeding (gastrostomy / NG tube). Nil by mouth

column2: Rate function during the preceding 2 week period only according to caregiver - Mobility
column17: 0 = Normal. No concerns. Age appropriate mobility
column18: 1 = Mild. Clumsy age appropriate mode of mobility
column19: 2 = Moderate. Mobile but through age inappropriate mode

column2: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only (or since birth if the child is less than 6 months old) unless otherwise stated in the question.  - Seisures
column18: 1 = Mild. Myoclonic or absence seizures only or < 1 generalised tonic-clonic seizure/month
column19: 2 = Moderate. > 5 generalized tonic-clonic seizures/month or > 20 absence or myoclonic seizures/month
column20: 3 = Severe. Status epilepticus or intractable seizures

column2: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only (or since birth if the child is less than 6 months old) unless otherwise stated in the question.  - Encephalopathy
column18: 1 = Mild. Abnormal sleepiness / lethargy. Waking only for feeds
column19: 2 = Moderate. Recurrent episodes of mild encephalopathy (> 2/year)
column20: 3 = Severe. Life threatening encephalopathy - requires artificial ventilation

column2: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only (or since birth if the child is less than 6 months old) unless otherwise stated in the question.  - Gastrointestinal
column18: 1 = Mild. Constipation or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea > 3/week
column19: 2 = Moderate. Severe constipation (no relief with laxative treatment) or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea every day or surgical intervention for dysmotility

column2: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only (or since birth if the child is less than 6 months old) unless otherwise stated in the question.  - Endocrine
column18: 1 = Mild. Biochemical evidence of impaired function
column19: 2 = Moderate. Endocrine failure requiring replacement therapy
column20: 3 = Severe. Endocrine decompensation (e.g. diabetic ketoacidosis, Addisonian crisis)

column2: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only (or since birth if the child is less than 6 months old) unless otherwise stated in the question.  - respiratory
column18: 1 = Mild. Abnormal respiratory pattern not requiring therapy / hospitalization
column19: 2 = Moderate. Abnormal respiration requiring oxygen flow or hospitalisation but not ventilation
column20: 3 = Severe. Abnormal respiration requiring artificial ventilation

column2: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only (or since birth if the child is less than 6 months old) unless otherwise stated in the question.  - cardiovascular
column19: 2 = Moderate. Abnormal echocardiogram (e.g. cardiomegaly) or sustained / symptomatic arrhythmia on ECG
column20: 3 = Severe. Decompensated cardiomyopathy or requiring pacing device / defibrillator / ablation

column2: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only (or since birth if the child is less than 6 months old) unless otherwise stated in the question.  - Renal
column18: 1 = Mild. Impaired function but no change in diet or therapy required
column19: 2 = Moderate. Impaired function requiring restricted protein diet

column2: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only (or since birth if the child is less than 6 months old) unless otherwise stated in the question.  - Liver
column18: 1 = Mild. Mildly impaired Liver Function Tests (LFTs). Normal albumin and coagulation. No symptoms of hepatic failure
column19: 2 = Moderate. Impaired LFTs with symptoms (e.g. jaundice, coagulation anomalies, oedema)
column20: 3 = Severe. Failure requiring hospitalisation and / or transplantation

column2: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only (or since birth if the child is less than 6 months old) unless otherwise stated in the question.  - blood
column19: 2 = Moderate. Asymptomatic pancytopenia
column20: 3 = Severe. Pancytopenia requiring regular transfusion / transplantation

column2: Rate current status according to the clinician’s examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. - Growth (weight) over preceding 6 months
column18: 1 = Mild. Weight less than second centile but growing parallel to it
column19: 2 = Moderate. Weight crossing one centile
column20: 3 = Severe. Weight crossing ? 2 centiles or less than 2nd centile with divergent trajectory

column2: Rate current status according to the clinician’s examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. - Development over preceding 4 months __ Score
Rate current status according to the clinician’s examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. -Vision
column18: 1 = Mild. Impaired fixation and / or tracking of small objects
column19: 2 = Moderate. Impaired fixation and / or tracking of familiar faces
column20: 3 = Severe. No response to light or registered blind

column2: Rate current status according to the clinician’s examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. - Ptosis and Eye Movement
column18: 1 = Mild. Gaze evoked nystagmus or unilateral ptosis or impaired eye movement at extremities
column19: 2 = Moderate. Intermittent nystagmus at rest or bilateral ptosis not obscuring pupils or restriction of >50% eye movement
column20: 3 = Severe. Continuous nystagmus at rest or bilateral ptosis obscuring pupils or only a flicker of eye movement

column2: Rate current status according to the clinician’s examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. - Myopathy
column18: 1 = Mild. Mild symmetrical weakness of hip and / or shoulder girdle only
column19: 2 = Moderate. Moderate symmetrical weakness (proximal > distal) limiting functional movement
column20: 3 = Severe. Wheelchair / carrier dependent or respiratory compromise due to myopathy.

column2: Rate current status according to the clinician’s examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. - Pyramidal
column18: 1 = Mild. Unilateral pyramidal signs but retaining functional movement
column19: 2 = Moderate. Dense hemiplegia with little movement of affected side
column20: 3 = Severe. Bilateral pyramidal weakness with little or no movement

column2: Rate current status according to the clinician’s examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. - Extrapyramidal
column18: 1 = Mild. Unilateral extrapyramidal posturing and increased tone
column19: 2 = Moderate. Bilateral extrapyramidal posturing and increased tone
column20: 3 = Severe. Severe extrapyramidal posturing resulting in very little movement

column2: Rate current status according to the clinician’s examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. - Neuropathy
column19: 2 = Moderate. Sensory ataxia or motor impairment (distal weakness) but mobile
column20: 3 = Severe. Reliant on mobility aids primarily due to neuropathy

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your child’s overall health?
column19: Fair

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how much did your child’s physical health problems limit their physical activities (such as moving or playing)?
column19: Somewhat

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how much energy did your child have?
column19: Somewhat

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how much bodily pain / discomfort did your child have?
column19: Somewhat

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your child’s behaviour compared with other children his / her age?
column19: Fair

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your child’s ability to interact with other people (e.g. with you, siblings or other children his / her age) compared with other children his / her age?
column19: Fair

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how much were you (the parent / carer) bothered by emotional problems (e.g. feelings of anxiety, sadness) as a result of your child’s illness?
column19: Somewhat

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how much was your time limited as a result of your child’s illness?
column19: Somewhat

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how much were your family’s activities limited or  interrupted as a result of your child’s illness?
column19: Moderately expensive

column2: During the past 6 months, what has been the financial cost of your child’s illness?
column19: Fair

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your family’s ability to get along with one another?
column19: Fair

column2: During the past 4 weeks, how often did your child’s illness have a positive effect on your child, you or your family (e.g. being treated well due to illness, meeting new people)?
column19: Sometimes
